1.text: I exhort, then, first of all, there be made supplications, prayers, intercessions, thanksgivings, for all men:

2.text: for kings, and all who are in authority, that a quiet and peaceable life we may lead in all piety and gravity,

3.text: for this is right and acceptable before God our Saviour,

4.text: who doth will all men to be saved, and to come to the full knowledge of the truth;

5.text: for one is God, one also is mediator of God and of men, the man Christ Jesus,

6.text: who did give himself a ransom for all—the testimony in its own times—

7.text: in regard to which I was set a preacher and apostle—truth I say in Christ, I do not lie—a teacher of nations, in faith and truth.

8.text: I wish, therefore, that men pray in every place, lifting up kind hands, apart from anger and reasoning;

9.text: in like manner also the women, in becoming apparel, with modesty and sobriety to adorn themselves, not in braided hair, or gold, or pearls, or garments of great price,

10.text: but—which becometh women professing godly piety—through good works.

11.text: Let a woman in quietness learn in all subjection,

12.text: and a woman I do not suffer to teach, nor to rule a husband, but to be in quietness,

13.text: for Adam was first formed, then Eve,

14.text: and Adam was not deceived, but the woman, having been deceived, into transgression came,

15.text: and she shall be saved through the child-bearing, if they remain in faith, and love, and sanctification, with sobriety.
